sub_title: ERC synergy laureate and professor in Microbiology at Radboud University
summary:
Since 2000, I am a professor in ecological microbiology at Radboud University specialized in the ecophysiology of anaerobic micro-organisms.
It is my goal to discover new (anaerobic) microbes at the oxic - anoxic interface of various ecosystems in close collaboration with complementary (inter)national experts. Once the microbes are enriched, I want to understand their (meta)genome and metabolism and to elucidate their role in the biogeochemical cycles of CH4 and nitrogen. 
Most famous examples are the discovery of anammox and anaerobic oxidation of methane-micobes that can be applied in waste water treatment and that play a significant role in the N & CH4 cycles. These bacteria have several unique features: such as production of the rocket fuel hydrazine, ladderane lipids and a prokaryotic organelle or the production oxygen form nitric oxide (see www.ru.nl/microbiology for more details). This research was awarded with an ERC Advanced Grant in 2008 and an ERC proof of concept grant in 2011. Based on these achievements, I have been elected into the Royal Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW) in 2010, and was awarded the most prestigious Science recognition in the Netherlands, the Spinozapremie in 2012. In 2013 Her Majesty  bestowed upon me a knighthood for exceptional service to science in the order of the Royal Lion of the Netherlands. In 2013, I was awarded a second ERC Advanced Grant on the ecology of  methane oxidizing microorganisms, and elected in to the Academia Europeae. Furthermore on 18 dec 2013, i was honored with a prestigious Gravitation Grant to establish the Soehngen Institute of Anaerobic Microbiology (SIAM) in collaboration with WUR, NIOZ and TUD. In May 2014 I was honored to become member of the EMBO organization. From  October 2010-2014, In 2016 I was elected into the European Academy of Micriobiology. In 2017 I received the award for best PhD supervisor of the year at the national PhD day. An ERC synergy grant together with Caroline Slomp of Utrecht University was retained in 2019 to investigate the removal of ammonium and methane from coastal sediments. For 10y, I served as director of the iwwr and deputy dean of the faculty of science.

treasury_media.description:
Please find the slides of my GRS seminar for young scientist attached. I hope it may give inspiration and advice to those pursuing academic careers.
Many thanks to Petra Rudolf, Curt Rice and many others for their input and thoughts on gender equality measures.
Science = Fun
Never Give Up!

I am not a big fan of e mail but I am not too difficult to find on social media if you would want more details or would like to give constructive feedback or input. thx


https://www.linkedin.com/in/mikejetten
@msmjetten

treasury_media.title: Top scientist Mike Jetten: the hunt for impossible bacteria
treasury_media.description: Prof. Mike Jetten is known to be a keen discoverer of small organisms. The Radboud Universities' microbiologist is honoured for his work with two ERC advanced grants and the Spinoza prize, the highest Dutch award in science. More information: http://www.ru.nl/research/nature

awards.title: Elected member of the European Academy of Microbiology
member EMBO organization
awards.description:
http://www.ru.nl/english/@940271/pagina/
Mike Jetten, Professor in microbiology at Radboud Universityis chosen as member of EMBO. ‘A great honour, and a good network opportunity for my PhD students,’ Jetten says in a reaction.

EMBO promotes excellence in the life sciences. The major goals of the organization are to support talented researchers at all stages of their careers, stimulate the exchange of scientific information, and help build a European research environment where scientists can achieve their best work.
EMBO has decided to strategically expand the scope of its membership on the occasion of its 50th anniversary to honour the progress that has been made in the fields of neuroscience and ecology & evolution.

awards.title: Gravitation Grant Soehngen Institute of anaerobic Microbiology
awards.description:
To help build a sustainable economy on new anaerobic micro-organisms. This is the proposal that earned a group of leading Dutch microbiologists a Gravitation grant (Zwaartekrachtsubsidie) from the Ministry of Education, Culture & Science. Prof. Mike Jetten from Radboud University Nijmegen and fellow-scientists from TU Delft, Wageningen University and the Royal Netherlands Institute for Sea Research (NIOZ) will use the funding to set up SIAM, an institute to identify new anaerobic-living micro-organisms with characteristics that will benefit the environment and health. Gravitation grants are intended to provide excellent Dutch scientific fields with the funding they need to carry out top level research.

The microbiologists in the SIAM (Soehngen Institute for Anaerobic Microbiology) consortium are tackling one of the greatest challenges facing our society: creating a sustainable economy based on biomass. Microbes that survive without oxygen will play an important role, whether they live alone or in complex microbiological communities. They have many important functions, such as producing biogas, for example, turning organic waste into degradable bioplastics or improving health by optimising the microflora in the gut. Micro-organisms can also be used to trap or even neutralise greenhouse gases. SIAM will search for as yet unidentified anaerobic microbes, while also focusing on training a new generation of microbiologists.

projects.title: Netherlands Earth System Science Centre
projects.description: The Netherlands Earth System Science Centre (ESSC) will bring together research into the climate of the past, present and future to improve the predictions about future climate conditions on our planet. Palaeoclimatologists, biogeoscientists and climate modellers will jointly work on research into the mutual interactions between geosphere, biosphere, hydrosphere and atmosphere on different timescales. The consortium will mainly focus on the influence of the carbon cycle to determine how warm the earth will become due to current disruptions to the carbon cycle and how sudden changes in the climate can take place.

projects.description:

This is the proposal that earned a group of leading Dutch microbiologists a Gravitation grant (Zwaartekrachtsubsidie) from the Ministry of Education, Culture & Science. Prof. Mike Jetten from Radboud University Nijmegen and fellow-scientists from TU Delft, Wageningen University and the Royal Netherlands Institute for Sea Research (NIOZ) will use the funding to set up SIAM, an institute to identify new anaerobic-living micro-organisms with characteristics that will benefit the environment and health. The microbiologists in the SIAM (Soehngen Institute for Anaerobic Microbiology) consortium are tackling one of the greatest challenges facing our society: creating a sustainable economy based on biomass. projects.title: radboud open access editor board
projects.description:
Wat is open access? 
Open access is een brede academische beweging die streeft naar vrije, gratis online toegang tot wetenschappelijke informatie, zoals tijdschriftartikelen, proefschriften en boeken. Iedereen kan de informatie lezen, downloaden, kopiëren, distribueren, printen, ernaar en erin zoeken, linken naar of indexeren van de fulltext publicatie, of anderszins gebruiken binnen de wettelijk geldende afspraken. Er zijn geen financiële, juridische of technische barrières.
De mate waarin open access gebruikt wordt om de zichtbaarheid en uitwisseling van onderzoeksresultaten te verbeteren, verschilt per wetenschappelijke discipline. Vooral fysica, wiskunde en economie hebben een lange traditie van openbaarmaking van preprints.
[bw] Voordeel: Grotere zichtbaarheid 
Vrije beschikbaarheid van informatie over de resultaten van onderzoek is van belang voor de wetenschap. Open access zorgt ervoor dat de informatie voor iedereen gratis toegankelijk is. Een kostbaar abonnement is niet nodig. Op deze manier wordt het lezerspubliek flink vergroot. Uit onderzoek blijkt dat artikelen die wereldwijd gratis toegankelijk zijn vaker worden gedownload en geciteerd.

profile_positions.title: Editor In Chief Anthonie van Leeuwenhoek Journal of Microbiology

profile_positions.description:
Discovery, ecology, physiology and application of new (anaerobic) micro-organisms and pathways involved in the global element cycles; anaerobic ammonium and methane oxidation; application of anaerobic bacteria for nitrogen and sulfur removal from water and air streams; (meta) genomics and proteomics of anaerobic microbes.

Recent Key publications
Ettwig et al. (2010) Nitrite-driven anaerobic methane oxidation by oxygenic bacteria. Nature 464:543-548.
Smeulders MJ, Barends TRM, et al (2011) Evolution of a new enzyme for carbon disulphide conversion by an acidothermophilic archaeon. Nature 478(7369): 412-6. 
Kartal B, Maalcke WJ, et al (2011) Molecular mechanism of anaerobic ammonium oxidation. Nature 479(7371): 127-30.
van de Vossenberg et al (2012) The metagenome of the marine anammox bacterium ‘Candidatus Scalindua profunda’illustrates the versatility of this globally important nitrogen cycle bacterium. Environmental Microbiology in press
profile_positions.title: Professor of Ecological Microbiology

profile_positions.description:
Radboud University’s Master specialization in Microbiology focuses on molecular, medical and environmental microbiology & biotechnology to improve our health and environment and provides in-depth insight into present-day microbial research in general and clinical microbiology.
www.ru.nl/masters/microbiology
profile_positions.title: Master of Microbiology MSc specialization

profile_positions.description: The Deputy Dean for Research facilitates fundamental and applied science within the faculty and its research institutes. He directs the faculty in planning and securing resources, and evaluating and implementing activities for the research program. The Deputy Dean actively participates in various Institutional planning, implementing, and evaluating research activities most notably PhD education, tenure track policy, gender equality balance, PR for master studies, and professionalization of the organization.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Dean for Research

profile_positions.description:
Water has been identified as a major environmental issue of the 21st century. Many parts of the world will experience increasing water shortage, while at other parts will have a higher incidence of flooding. Poor water quality is a threat for human society as well as for natural ecosystems. The research focus of the Institute for Water and Wetland Research is the natural environment, in particular aquatic ecosystems and wetlands. Many of these environments have been substantially altered by human impact. The changes have resulted in stress responses of all living biota and impose major challenges to individuals, populations and the ecosystem as a whole. The IWWR studies the mechanisms of adaptation to these changes of micro-organisms, plants and animals at the level of the molecule, the cell, the organism and the ecosystem. see more on http://www.ru.nl/iwwr/
Raghoebarsing AA, et al  (2005) Methanotrophic symbionts provide carbon for photosynthesis in peat bogs. Nature 436: 1153-1156.
profile_positions.title: Director of Research IWWR
